[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Despite his unfriendliness towards you, he's actually the most easygoing of the group if you've gotten suspended from the Brotherhood by attacking one of the members, reassuring you that everyone breaks the rules on occasion and saying it seems to happen with him at least once a month.
[Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal):  (SPOILER) During Maro's attack on the Sanctuary, or by you if you "Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!" instead of joining it.
[Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass): Alongside Festus, he will be hostile to you from the get-go, though less so if you are a werewolf.

[Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand):  (SPOILER) When Maro attacks the Sanctuary, he's fighting off his attacks as he's cut down. Notably, his death is scripted, so there's nothing you can do about it; if he does actually defeat the soldiers he's fighting, he will spontaneously keel over immediately afterward.

[The Nicknamer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheNicknamer): He tends to refer to you as food, like "Beef Roast", "Ham Hock" or "Morsel", though he states he doesn't mean anything by it since, as a werewolf, he sees everyone as food.

[Square Race, Round Class](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SquareRaceRoundClass): He's an assassin who's not only a werewolf, but also a former member of the Companions (a faction who are generally disdainful of stealth) who uses a battleaxe as his main weapon. However, he wears the Shrouded Armor of the Dark Brotherhood. However, there's some [Fridge Brilliance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FridgeBrilliance) at play: in werewolf form, he would be unrecognizable to most, potentially allowing him to murder people in plain sight and run off into the night without risking a bounty on his head. Not to mention that the authorities might simply dismiss the murder as a random attack by a feral monster, rather than a deliberate murder.

[Suspiciously Similar Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuspiciouslySimilarSubstitute): Of Gogron gro-Bolmog, the orc member of *Oblivion* 's  Dark Brotherhood. Like Gogron, Arnbjorn is [somewhat unsuited for stealth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SquareRaceRoundClass), though unlike Gogron, he wears Light Armor. Arnbjorn also has shades of M'raaj-Dar, in that he just plain does *not* like you  (SPOILER) especially after you get named Listener and become a threat to his wife's authority  and there's really nothing you can do about that.  (SPOILER) Like M'raaj-Dar, Arnbjorn also starts to warm to you right before he dies, though at least this time it's not by your hand.
[Token Evil Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenEvilTeammate): Not for the Dark Brotherhood, obviously, but he used to be this for the Companions. Eventually, they kicked him out over it.
[Took a Level in Kindness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInKindness): After you  (SPOILER) take care of Cicero , he is much kinder towards you, to the point of calling you  (SPOILER) "Tidbit."
[Unholy Matrimony](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnholyMatrimony): He's married to Astrid, and [he loves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyMarried) his "beautiful wife".

[Actor Allusion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActorAllusion): Could reasonably be considered the [Evil Twin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilTwin) of [Three Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/Fallout3), with the [Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker) turned up to eleven.

[Black Dude Dies First](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackDudeDiesFirst):
    - (SPOILER) Inverted - he's one of the only two survivors of the Penitus Oculatus raid on the Sanctuary, especially since, among those that can survive, he's the only one whom you can realistically expect to die. Cicero, at that point, is either dead by your hands or safe in the Dawnstar Sanctuary, and Babette, being ([ostensibly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Really700YearsOld)) a child, is protected under Bethesda's policy of "no child-killing". - (SPOILER) But if you decide to destroy the Dark Brotherhood instead of joining them, you *do* kill him, and only Babette and Cicero survive. Nazir's still not the first to die, though, since the first person you're likely to encounter upon entering the sanctuary will be either Arnbjorn or Veezara.

[Brutal Honesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalHonesty): Nazir isn't a man to keep opinions to himself, and when you first join up, he'll be fairly vocal about how little he believes in you.  (SPOILER) Even during the Sanctuary raid, he admits that he had thoughts that it might have been you who sold them out, up until you saved his ass literal seconds ago.

[The Comically Serious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheComicallySerious): Has a lengthy list of entertainers he hates, and is rarely without a darkly humorous remark or his usual consummate tone. He'll also complain about Cicero's dancing if you spared him.

[Consummate Professional](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConsummateProfessional): Compared to others, he's more concerned with getting contracts done rather than with the more religious aspects of the Dark Brotherhood. He doesn't care too much *how* they're done, though, just that they *are*.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker):
QUOTE **Nazir:** [Congratulations. You slaughtered an emaciated beggar in cold blood. You are truly an opponent to be feared.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SarcasmMode)

[Defiant to the End](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefiantToTheEnd):  (SPOILER) When the Penitus Oculatus shows up and torches the Sanctuary, Nazir elects to go down swinging and taking as many of them down with him as he can. 
QUOTE  **Nazir:** If I am to die today, so be it. But you'll not soon forget the Dark Brotherhood.
[Defrosting Ice King](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefrostingIceKing): A dark version, but he gradually warms up to you.

[The Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDragon):  (SPOILER) He becomes your [Number Two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberTwo) in the Dawnstar Sanctuary, mainly due to the lack of anyone else to take up the position.

[Even Evil Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasStandards): After the Dragonborn assassinates a vampire, he genuinely praises you and refuses to mock you. He says that you went toe-to-toe with a vampire and won, and that's something worth praise.
QUOTE  "No sarcasm this time. You faced a vampire and lived to tell the tale. Well done."
[Evil Sounds Deep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSoundsDeep): He has the deepest voice of anyone in the Sanctuary.

[Fragile Speedster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FragileSpeedster): Subverted. He's the Master Trainer for Light Armor, but [oddly enough](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InformedAttribute), he does not wear it himself (his Redguard-themed attire is classed as plain clothing) and he's actually closer to being [Made of Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadeOfIron), given that he survives the raid as noted above.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Arabic for "[harbinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HarbingerOfImpendingDoom)", which is appropriate enough for a guy who hands out contracts to kill people.

[No True Scotsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoTrueScotsman): His sentiments toward a Redguard Dragonborn at their first meeting.
QUOTE  "I am Redguard if you hadn't noticed, but not like you, no, not like you."

[Pungeon Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PungeonMaster): After you complete one of your first contracts.
QUOTE **Nazir:** Of course the miner is dead, I've heard their industry is rather... cutthroat! And those hours? Murder. I can keep this up all day.
[Scary Black Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScaryBlackMan): He's a Redguard with a deep voice working with the Dark Brotherhood, and he's not too friendly either.
[Self-Made Orphan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfMadeOrphan): After his father taught him to cook, Nazir *killed him*. [Why he did this is never mentioned](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident).

[Sergeant Rock](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SergeantRock): While working for Nazir, count on him to take the piss out of you pretty regularly. The best you will get is a "good enough" because his standards are uncompromising.  (SPOILER) As shown during the siege on the Sanctuary, he has the fortitude and skill to be well worth those standards.

[Sincerity Mode](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SincerityMode): One of the contracts he offers is on a vampire; after you do the deed, Nazir says, "No sarcasm this time" and praises you for fighting a vampire and living to tell the tale. Another contract is on a maid working in an occupied fort. He decides not to quip about killing the defenseless woman and praises you for managing to infiltrate the fort and make it out alive. Lastly, he becomes genuinely impressed when you complete your final contract with him on a pirate captain, which he describes as the most challenging.

[Sinister Scimitar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SinisterScimitar): One of the *very* few named [NPCs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonPlayerCharacter) of any prominence to wield one in the game. This is unsurprising, as he basically looks like a red-garbed Alik'r warrior, who all wield ["curved](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NationalWeapon) [swords"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MemeticMutation).
[Sleepy Head](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleepyHead): Due to a bug, he may be found lying in bed almost all of the time in the PC version.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): To Astrid.  (SPOILER) Later this shifts to the Dragonborn, after Astrid's death and the Falkreath sanctuary's destruction .
QUOTE **Nazir:** I'll follow you until I'm dust in the breeze. You realize that, right?
[Ungrateful Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UngratefulBastard): See [Self-Made Orphan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfMadeOrphan).

[Beneath Suspicion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathSuspicion):  (SPOILER) Her survival is possibly foreshadowed in her conversation with the Dragonborn, where she recites her [rehearsed story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrazyPrepared) that the Dark Brotherhood killed her parents and took her captive. With the multiple purges the Brotherhood has suffered since the Oblivion Crisis, Babette might have had to use this story before.

[Cheerful Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CheerfulChild): Hey, just because she's a three hundred year-old vampire doesn't mean she can't act her apparent age. Babette is overall one of the chirpier, more welcoming members of the Brotherhood.
[Creepy Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreepyChild): She was turned into a vampire when she was ten years old.

[Crouching Moron, Hidden Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrouchingMoronHiddenBadass): Her default murder method is to pretend to be a naive helpless little girl, get her target alone, and then turn them into a bloody stain on the cobblestone.
[Deliberately Cute Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeliberatelyCuteChild): Her preferred tactic when assassinating is to pretend to be a normal innocent child.
[Enfant Terrible](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnfantTerrible): She may look like any other kid, but she's a vampire assassin of three hundred years.

[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): Of Vicente Valtieri from *Oblivion's* Dark Brotherhood, who was also a vampire. Unlike Vicente, though, she doesn't give you any quests and never offers to turn you into a vampire like he did.
[Even Evil Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasStandards): She is sad that you must kill  (SPOILER) the best chef in all Tamriel, because she loves his recipes.

[Improbable Infant Survival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableInfantSurvival): Both literally and figuratively.  (SPOILER) She doesn't even show up if you decide to take the "Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!" route, and if you go through the faction questline, the Dark Brotherhood is eventually attacked by Commander Maro's troops and she ends up being one of the few survivors, along with you and Nazir (and Cicero, if you spared him) .

[Karma Houdini](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KarmaHoudini):  (SPOILER) Due to the fact children can't be killed in the game, if you decide to wipe out the Dark Brotherhood, she doesn't appear, and presumably escapes justice. If you join the Dark Brotherhood, she's also one of the only two members present at Commander Maro's attack (the other being Nazir) who isn't killed by Imperial troops.

tropeName: Kick The Son Of A Bitch
tropeNotes: [Kick The Son Of A Bitch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickTheSonOfABitch): Beyond Aventus Aretino's contract and Astrid's abduction, the [Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment) of the Dark Brotherhood itself has her narrating to her teammates how she took advantage of [her appearance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeliberatelyCuteChild) to bait and kill a child molester.

[Little Miss Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LittleMissBadass): You don't see her fight anyone, but she has a few tales of such.  (SPOILER) Also, she *has* to be a badass to not get slaughtered by Commander Maro's troops like everyone else in the Brotherhood save Nazir, although since you meet her and Nazir after the fact, how she survived is left unclear.

[Master Poisoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterPoisoner): The master trainer for Alchemy. Given that she's a member of the Dark Brotherhood, the implications of what she uses that knowledge for should be obvious.
[Our Vampires Are Different](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OurVampiresAreDifferent): The only vampire in-game who isn't an adult.
[Really 700 Years Old](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Really700YearsOld): She's over three hundred on account of her vampirism.

[Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut): She's possibly this to Claudia, from *[Interview with the Vampire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/InterviewWithTheVampire)*; her French name, the fact that she was made a vampire as a child, and the way she uses her appearance to bait victims would suggest as much.
[Undead Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndeadChild): Cicero even calls her "the unchild."
[Affably Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffablyEvil): He's a soft-spoken, all-around pleasant [Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy), except for the fact that he's also a cold-blooded murderer.

tropeName: Desperately Looking for a Purpose in Life
tropeNotes: [Desperately Looking for a Purpose in Life](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesperatelyLookingForAPurposeInLife): Before meeting the Dark Brotherhood, at least.
[I Owe You My Life](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IOweYouMyLife): To Astrid, who gave him a reason to live again... specifically, killing people.
[Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal):  (SPOILER) During Maro's attack on the Sanctuary, if you don't opt to destroy the Brotherhood yourself.

[Last of His Kind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastOfHisKind): He's the last known Shadowscale.  (SPOILER) Unfortunately, once you finish the questline, the order has become extinct; depending on whether you destroyed the Dark Brotherhood or joined them, he's killed by either you or Commander Maro's troops.

[Taking the Bullet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingTheBullet): When Cicero loses his temper with Astrid for insulting the Night Mother, Veezara gets in the way and protects her from being hurt by the jester's knife. He survives.
[We Need a Distraction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeNeedADistraction): Helps divert attention from you after a deliberately public assassination.

[Bread, Eggs, Breaded Eggs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreadEggsBreadedEggs): She likes moonlit nights, seaside strolls, unicorns, and knitting. She then recounts when she stabbed a unicorn to death with a sewing needle while on a moonlit walk on the beach.
[Familiar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Familiar): Lis the Frostbite Spider is her familiar, according to the official strategy guide, though it notes that Lis is treated more like a pet than anything.
[Foreseeing My Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForeseeingMyDeath): Claims to have already predicted the circumstances of her death, although she doesn't discuss the details.
[Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal):  (SPOILER) During Maro's attack on the Sanctuary (or yours, if you "Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!" instead of joining it).
[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton): When this man says he wants his bath water tepid, he means *tepid*. His wife found out the hard way that lukewarm is *not* tepid.

[The Brute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBrute): He isn't stupid, mind you, as he's an accomplished sorcerer. But unlike his comrades, he prefers brutally murdering his targets point blank with powerful spells as opposed to stealth and sneaky tactics. Despite that, he has a special ring that boosts Destruction and Sneak that he'll give the player as a bonus if they hide The Gourmet's body.
[Defrosting Ice King](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefrostingIceKing): Towards you.
[Disproportionate Retribution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisproportionateRetribution): Murdered his wife because she made lukewarm bathwater for him instead of tepid.
[Evil Old Folks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilOldFolks): The oldest member of the Brotherhood (physically, anyway), and he loves seeing people horrifically turn to ashes before his eyes.

[Evil Sorcerer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSorcerer): He's practically obsessed with the more gruesome applications of magic, almost to a [When All You Have Is a Hammer…](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenAllYouHaveIsAHammer) level.

[For Science!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForScience): Was formerly a professor at the College of Winterhold before he decided that he wished to explore the "intricacies" of the Destruction school. Specifically, making spells that killed in more gruesome ways.
[Grumpy Old Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrumpyOldMan): Describes himself as the "cranky old uncle" of the Dark Brotherhood family.
[Human Pincushion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanPincushion):  (SPOILER) When you find him dead, he's pinned to a tree by about *twenty* arrows.
[Kill It with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithFire): All of his Destruction spells are fire-based.
[Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal):  (SPOILER) Either during Maro's attack on the Sanctuary, or yours.
[Laughably Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaughablyEvil): His grumpy mannerisms help in this.

[Square Race, Round Class](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SquareRaceRoundClass): There are many occupations you may associate with an assassin. [Destruction magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StuffBlowingUp) is probably not one of them, but here he is.

tropeName: There Is No Kill Like Overkill
tropeNotes: [There Is No Kill Like Overkill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThereIsNoKillLikeOverkill): His preferred method of assassination is the liberal application of powerful Destruction spells directly to the target. If asked for advice on your current mission, he'll recommend this for you as well. Ironically,  (SPOILER) when the Dark Brotherhood sanctuary is attacked by the Penitus Oculatus , Festus is  (SPOILER) found pinned to a tree by *twenty arrows* .

tropeName: When All You Have Is a Hammer…
tropeNotes: [When All You Have Is a Hammer…](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenAllYouHaveIsAHammer): He appreciates the stealth aspect of assassination, but he prefers to simply... well, he says it himself:

[Affably Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffablyEvil): He'll only harm people if he's given enough reason to. In *Delayed Burial*, he'll pay the Dragonborn for helping him and Loreius is rewarded or left alone. However, if Cicero is framed for a crime then he'll break out and murder Loreius and his wife for forcing him to desecrate The Night Mother's coffin to prove his innocence. Also, despite his obsession with becoming the Listener,  (SPOILER) he doesn't hold it against the Dragonborn when they get the role instead and becomes [unwaveringly loyal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty) to them if he's spared.
[All There in the Manual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual): An in-game version. His backstory and motivations are only revealed if you read his journals.

[Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy): His default state of mind. If he's your follower, anyone showing any kind of hostility toward you will get knifed to death, which may lead to bounty problems if this happens in a major city.

[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton): Disrespecting the Night Mother makes him even more murder-happy than usual; after all, as Keeper, it's his job to guard her. He threatens to shank the Dragonborn on the spot when he finds them inside the Night Mother's coffin ([long story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItMakesSenseInContext)) until they give him her [Trust Password](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrustPassword), and later tries to murder Astrid for slandering her name.

[Beware the Silly Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheSillyOnes): You do not become the keeper of the Night Mother without being *very* dangerous. He can be encountered on the road with a broken wagon. If you convince a farmer suspicious of him to have him arrested, said farmer will end up dead.
[Chekhov's Gunman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGunman): It's possible to encounter him (and his "passenger") on the road long before you ever join the Dark Brotherhood, or even if you never do.

[Cloud Cuckoolander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CloudCuckoolander): The only Dark Brotherhood member who still cares about the Night Mother, regularly attempting to communicate with her. His isolation, obsession, and the deaths of his fellow assassins in Cyrodiil have left him... quite unhinged.

[Coffin Contraband](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoffinContraband): Played with. His coffin containing "his mother" doesn't contain drugs or weapons, it contains the *Night Mother*, so he was telling the [Metaphorically True](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MetaphoricallyTrue).
[Creepy High-Pitched Voice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreepyHighPitchedVoice): He's a psychotic jester with a very high-pitched voice for a man.
[Crouching Moron, Hidden Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrouchingMoronHiddenBadass): He manages to incapacitate  (SPOILER) Arnbjorn  with just his knife. As a follower, he's relatively powerful.

[Even Evil Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasStandards): As devoted to the Listener as he may be, Cicero will still refuse to sleep in other people's beds when ordered to.
QUOTE  *"Now wait a minute, Listener. Even Cicero has his limits! Not many, mind you... but I do have them!"*
[Evil Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilRedhead): Has shoulder-length red hair that's mostly obscured by his hat.

[The Friend Nobody Likes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFriendNobodyLikes): No one in the Dark Brotherhood is particularly fond of him, tolerating his presence solely because he's a member of the Brotherhood. Ironically, the one that actually tolerates him the most is *[Festus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrumpyOldMan)*.
[Giggling Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GigglingVillain): Likely a mix of his jester persona and his own craziness.

[Green-Eyed Monster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GreenEyedMonster): Considering the fact that he was never named Listener despite his many prayers to the Night Mother and his years of loyal service and devotion, one might reasonably expect that the Dragonborn appearing out of nowhere and becoming Listener overnight might grate on him.  (SPOILER) [It doesn't](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AvertedTrope), he's just happy that the Dark Brotherhood can finally function properly, and is satisfied with his role as Keeper. But he seems aware of how people might perceive him and uses it to pull a prank on the Dragonborn if he's spared.
[Happy Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappyDance): Once in a while, he'll do a jig on the spot.
[Happy Harlequin Hat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappyHarlequinHat): Wears a jester's hat to complement his psychotic clown persona.<!--zce* ISurrenderSuckers: See WoundedGazelleGambit.-->
[In-Universe Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InUniverseNickname): He calls himself "The Fool of Hearts". Everyone else just calls him a fool.

[Karma Houdini](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KarmaHoudini):  (SPOILER) Along with Babette, he will not be present in the Sanctuary if you're there to wipe out the Brotherhood. Evidently, he'll never finish the trip.
[Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam): What else would you expect from an [Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy) jester?

[Married to the Job](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MarriedToTheJob): He's completely devoted to the Night Mother and will fly into an absolute fury if someone disrespects her in his presence.  (SPOILER) The Night Mother, in turn, is respectful towards him, regarding him as "Poor Cicero. Dear Cicero. Such a humble servant."

[Metaphorically True](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MetaphoricallyTrue): When encountered in Whiterun, he asks for your help because he's trying to bring the corpse of his mother to a new crypt but he's having trouble convincing Loreius the farmer to help him. Loreius believes he's lying and is alarmed by his behaviour. Well, if you join the Dark Brotherhood; Loreius is revealed to be half-right. The mother in the coffin isn't *his* mother but the *Night Mother* and the crypt itself is the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary in Falkreath. The sanctuary is found close to the local graveyard, which can be mistaken as a crypt at a far enough distance. Making his statements true from a certain point of view.

[Monster Clown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MonsterClown): The most openly psychotic member of the Dark Brotherhood whose devotion to the Night Mother comes off as more than a bit Oedipal in nature. The persona is partly because his last contract before becoming the Keeper was to kill a jester, which - combined with his [Sanity Slippage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage) - eventually came to break him.

[Obviously Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObviouslyEvil): When he's stranded in the middle of the road due to a damaged wheel of his carriage, a local farmer [refuses to help him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProperlyParanoid) because of Cicero's incredibly suspicious behavior. Should you decide to involve yourself in the matter, the farmer will end up dead if you don't persuade him to help Cicero.

[Pragmatic Villainy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PragmaticVillainy): He prefers to focus his energies on maintaining his duties as The Night Mother's keeper. He rewards Loreius and the Dragonborn for helping fix his wagon and won't cause any trouble unless given a sufficient enough reason.
[Psycho Knife Nut](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychoKnifeNut): One of the most obviously and violently insane people in Skyrim, and his weapon of choice is an ebony dagger.

[Random Event](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RandomEvent): He's a walking one of these, in that Cicero is the only member of the Dark Brotherhood you might encounter even if you never commit the murder that brings you to the guild's attention. Meeting him is especially likely if you have *Hearthfire* installed; the farm where his wagon breaks down is the immediate neighbor of the plot of land where Heljarchen Hall (the home you can build if you become Thane of the Pale) is constructed.

[Right for the Wrong Reasons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RightForTheWrongReasons): The farmer that refuses to help Cicero cites his [very suspicious behavior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObviouslyEvil) and the fact that his coffin [probably contains drugs or weapons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoffinContraband). While he's absolutely correct that Cicero is up to something, it's nothing as mundane as he thinks.

[Sanity Slippage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage): His journals reveal that years of obsessively watching over the Night Mother without ever once being named Listener or encountering a Listener while the Dark Brotherhood collapsed all around him really took their toll on his mind. Adding to this was his last contract before taking up the duty of Keeper: a jester. Cicero kept on recalling his time with the jester and eventually took up his mannerisms.

[Suspiciously Similar Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuspiciouslySimilarSubstitute): To Mathieu Bellamont, being an [Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy) member of the Brotherhood who's obsessed with his mother  (SPOILER) and betrays them due to his obsession . Although in Cicero's case, he's obsessed with the Night Mother rather than his biological one  (SPOILER) and he doesn't kill any of them for it, only wounding two of them after coming to blows with Astrid .
[Sycophantic Servant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SycophanticServant): Towards the Night Mother.  (SPOILER) If he's alive by the end of the Dark Brotherhood questline, he becomes this to the Dragonborn.
[Third-Person Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThirdPersonPerson): He slips in and out of this rather inconsistently. It helps that he's completely mad.

[Troll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll): If spared,  (SPOILER) he shows up to the new Sanctuary in a rage, claiming that [he should have become Listener, not the Dragonborn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivenByEnvy), and that [he will make them regret letting him live](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFarmerAndTheViper). After a [Beat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Beat), he starts laughing at the Dragonborn's presumably shocked expression, reveals that he is just joking around and professes his [Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty) to the new Listener.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): Cicero is completely devoted to the Night Mother and anyone who disparages her will get stabbed. Violently and multiple times. If you become the Listener, Cicero extends this loyalty to you as well and addresses you with nothing less than complete reverence.

[Wounded Gazelle Gambit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WoundedGazelleGambit): He appears badly injured when  (SPOILER) he asks you to spare his life. If you attack him but are not strong enough to kill him in one hit, he's as spry as ever. 
QUOTE  *"Ha ha! Behold the final trick of the Fool of Hearts! You think me near death? Think again!"*
[Yandere](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Yandere): For the Night Mother.  (SPOILER) And even starts to show shades of this towards the player if you spare him.

[You Fool!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouFool): If you spare him and head to the Dawnstar Sanctuary later in the questline, he'll greet you with a monologue about how much of a fool you were to spare him and that he'll kill you now.  (SPOILER) He then reveals that he's just kidding, while laughing at the apparent look on your face.

[Awesome, but Impractical](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AwesomeButImpractical): The ghost of  (SPOILER) Lucien Lachance  has arguably the most badass and well-voiced combat dialogue of any character in the game. It's a shame that his sole fighting tactic is to charge headlong into the thickest of the fighting clad in only light armor and brandishing an iron dagger. Higher level-scaled enemies tend to make short work of him. That is, until you install *Dawnguard*, craft a Dragonbone Bow enchanted with Absorb Health and Paralysis and a set of Dragonbone Arrows, and drop both beside him before combat starts. Time it right, and  (SPOILER) Lucien  will actually ignore all the fighting, pick up the set and thereafter become a permanently self-reliant, committed long-ranged killing machine who fast travels with the set until he's dispelled by another summon or killed by overwhelming force.

[Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy): While  (SPOILER) Lucien Lachance  could hardly be considered a man of peace, he seems to have entirely dispensed with the "stealth" aspect of his vocation after becoming one with the Void. He will not sneak when the player does and will instead draw attention to himself by eagerly charging at any nearby enemy with only a knife.
QUOTE *"Perhaps we should find... a random stranger to murder! Practice does make perfect..."*

[Belated Happy Ending](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BelatedHappyEnding):  (SPOILER) Despite his rather horrific end in *Oblivion*, he's deemed important and loyal enough to Sithis and the Night Mother to endure beyond death, likely because the Night Mother herself vouched for his devotion to the Black Hand.
[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): "I grow restless... as does my blade."

[Came Back Wrong](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CameBackWrong):  (SPOILER) He's certainly less *collected* than he was in the last game, perhaps due in part to the details of his death (see the Nightmare Fuel page for a description).

[Even Evil Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasStandards): He may be as cold-blooded in death as he was in life, but he is uneasy about killing Cicero, who holds the sacred title as Keeper, regardless of his lunacy. He will help you kill Cicero, but he warns you that it is not the will of Sithis.
[Evil Sounds Deep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSoundsDeep): Courtesy of his VA. Highlight the spoiler to work it out.
[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): He's essentially an evil [Obi-Wan Kenobi with a bit of Darth Sidious on the side](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/StarWars).
[Fearless Undead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FearlessUndead): "There is no pain in the Void!"
[I Am Who?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IAmWho):  (SPOILER) Lucien Lachance
[Implacable Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImplacableMan): Of a sort. He will assist you until he falls, and can be summoned again if he does.
[Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam): **I LIVE AGAIN!**

[Motor Mouth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MotorMouth): A variant of this trope in that while (SPOILER) Lucien's speech is still perfectly coherent and steady, he *never shuts up*. He'll go off on an [echoing deep-voiced](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSoundsDeep) tangent about past events or enacting violence (or both) in any location to which he accompanies you without being prompted, even in the middle of a Falmer- or draugr-infested dungeon or a conversation with another NPC. This wouldn't be too much of a problem... until you've heard (SPOILER) ["the tale of Mathieu Bellamont and the great treachery of Cheydinhal"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WelcomeToCorneria) *for the millionth time*. So much for preferring the (SPOILER) "symphony of death" .
    - It's gotten to the point where players have written guides on how to "kill" him without incurring a penalty for it.

[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog):
QUOTE  (SPOILER) "Shadowmere... my old and dear friend."

[Ambiguous Gender](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousGender): Considered male by Astrid,  (SPOILER) but Lucien calls Shadowmere a "she" in *Oblivion* . It seems implied that she simply does not know the actual gender, and just guessed.
[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): If an enemy is nearby, it *will* feel this horse's hooves.
[Hellish Horse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellishHorse): This Brotherhood-exclusive steed is *the* hardiest in all of Skyrim.

[Nigh-Invulnerable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NighInvulnerable): Has more health than other horses and regenerates it extremely quickly. The only things that can kill her are very long vertical drops and amplified backstabs.
[Red Eyes, Take Warning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedEyesTakeWarning): Has glowing red eyes.

[Resurrective Immortality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ResurrectiveImmortality): Even if something manages to get through its massive amount of regenerating health to kill it, it will come back to life ten days later at the point where you originally met it outside the (original) Dark Brotherhood sanctuary.

[Action-Hero Babysitter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionHeroBabysitter): With the addition of the *Hearthfire* DLC, the housecarls become these. They will do everything in their power to protect the Dragonborn's children from bandits and other random attacks.

[Artificial Brilliance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialBrilliance): If a fight is beginning to look a little one-sided, they'll snatch up a staff they found lying on the ground and use it to even the odds.

[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): They don't need fancy magic or an ancient language to keep up with the Dovahkiin. But they won't hesitate to use a staff if you give one to them, or it is lying around for them to use.

[Battle Butler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleButler): They carry your goods if you request it, and, when not following and protecting you, they stay at home to guard your house, your children and anything you own. Starting with *Hearthfire*, they share this position with your Stewards.
[Blonde, Brunette, Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlondeBrunetteRedhead): Jordis, Lydia, and Iona respectively.
[Bodyguard Crush](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyguardCrush): If you wear an Amulet of Mara while speaking to them...
[Bodyguarding a Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyguardingABadass): That badass being *you*, of course.

[Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Catchphrase):
QUOTE "Honor to you, my Thane." 
"Long life to you, Thane." 
["I am sworn to carry your burdens."](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SarcasmMode) 
"As you will, my Thane. I will protect you with my life."

tropeName: Did You Just Flip Off Cthulhu?
tropeNotes:
[Did You Just Flip Off Cthulhu?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustFlipOffCthulhu): They have *special* trash talk reserved for *dragons!*
QUOTE "You'll die this day, dragon!"
[The Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDragon): To an evil Dragonborn. They won't hesitate to murder a defenseless old lady if you give them the order.

[Hypercompetent Sidekick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HypercompetentSidekick): They can generally scout traps and be aware of an enemy's presence before you are. They can absorb more punishment than you (technically, since they're difficult to kill) and at early levels, they might be stronger than you. Also, unlike you, they and all other followers have no cap on either armor or magic defense, allowing them to block nearly all damage, potentially, rather than capping at 80% for armor for the Dovahkiin or 85% magic and poison resist.

[Insult Friendly Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InsultFriendlyFire): As almost all of them are Nords, they are prone to using "Skyrim for the Nords!" as well as various racial insults as a battlecry, even if they happen to serve a non-Nord.
[The Lancer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLancer): They are "your sword and your shield".
[No-Sell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSell): They have no cap for their resistances, so they can potentially resist 100% of magic, poison and physical strikes.

[Only Six Faces](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlySixFaces): The female Housecarls seem to have the exact same faces, to the point where Lydia and Jordis the Sword-Maiden almost look like palette-swaps of one another. Iona at least has a different hairstyle.

[Static Role, Exchangeable Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StaticRoleExchangeableCharacter): They all have the exact same role in the game, the same stats, almost the same equipment, and, before *Dragonborn* added some unique dialogue for Lydia, the same lines as well.
[Trash Talk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrashTalk): All of them use it when facing down enemies.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): They will put up with almost anything you do and agree to almost any order. In fact, it's easier to list the things they *won't* let you get away with:
    - Attacking them repeatedly. - Becoming a Stage 4 vampire (if *Dawnguard* isn't installed) or werewolf (if they are not a follower). - [...And making them sleep in someone else's bed.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArsonMurderAndJaywalking) QUOTE "Not for you. Not for *anyone*." - Particularly notable is that Housecarls will fight by your side even if you're fighting against the very Jarls who assigned them to you. (SPOILER) Lydia and (SPOILER) Jordis the Sword-Maiden will stay right by your side while (SPOILER) invading Whiterun or Solitude , with (SPOILER) Lydia actively participating in (SPOILER) directly fighting the very Jarl who assigned her to you, personally .
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): She's likely the first female follower you can recruit, unless you're doing a non-dragon run, and is a proficient warrior.
[Ascended Meme](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedMeme): Lydia originally had only *one* sarcastic line. This was upped in *Dragonborn*.

[Breakout Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakoutCharacter): She's pretty much the poster girl for the game, as the first housecarl met in the main questline and likely the player's first companion (Sven or Faendal in Riverwood can be missed easily), and she has a bit of sarcasm and badassery to make her memorable. The *Hearthfire* and *Dragonborn* DLC further expand her personality in subtle ways with new dialogue and changes to her behavior, something done for no other Housecarl.

[Cuteness Proximity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutenessProximity): A very strange example. When fighting the diminutive but murderous Rieklings:
QUOTE **Lydia:** I don't know whether to kill it or pet it.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Aside from the classic line above, Lydia gets a tremendous boost to her snarkiness in the *Dragonborn* DLC, especially if you  (SPOILER) start using the Black Books .

[Disc-One Nuke](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscOneNuke): She's one of the first followers you can recruit, and her invincibility combined with her high stats and strong default equipment make her possibly more powerful than *you* when you recruit her. She'll continue to be just as powerful late into the game, since she levels to 50 like all housecarls and due to that, her One-handed, Block and Heavy Armor stats are maxed out at 100 and her Archery is sitting pretty at 98.
[First Girl Wins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FirstGirlWins): If married. She's your first houscarl and likely to be your first follower.

[No Hero to His Valet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoHeroToHisValet): No matter how badass, famous or influential the Dragonborn is, Lydia will keep snarking the same or otherwise harmlessly disrespect them.

[Sarcastic Devotee](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SarcasticDevotee): She is sworn to carry your burdens. Doesn't mean she's happy about it, though. With *Hearthfire*, she eventually drops the snark the more you travel with her. She has a lot more sarcastic dialogue in *Dragonborn*.
[Hot Blooded Sideburns](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBloodedSideburns): He sports an impressive pair of muttonchops.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Like all female companions, she's a very powerful fighter.

[Continuity Nod](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContinuityNod): His name and the house he protects, Vlindrel Hall, are both nods to *Knights of the Nine*. Fort Bulwark was where you found the Shield of the Crusader, and Berich Vlindrel was one of the original knights.
[Facial Markings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacialMarkings): The only housecarl with war paint.
[Hunk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hunk): Among the most traditionally handsome male followers and potential husbands.

tropeName: Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me
tropeNotes: [Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LuckilyMyShieldWillProtectMe): As his sobriquet implies, he prefers a shield and one-handed weapon combination, and utilizes blocking and shield bashing in combat.
[Manly Facial Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyFacialHair): His goatee adds to his masculine appearance.
[The Quiet One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheQuietOne): Argis uses the Male Brute voice set, so his lines are short and to the point.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Her name says it all.

[Awesome, but Impractical](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AwesomeButImpractical): As stated before, all housecarls are equal in stats, which is unfortunate considering how much cost and effort one must undertake to get Jordis.
[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): She has the default "young lady" voice, and tends to express glee when brought along into exotic and impressive locales.

[Beware the Nice Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheNiceOnes): Her voice and dialogue give the impression that she's the friendliest out of the housecarls. Doesn't make her any less brutal in a fight, nor does it keep her from yelling threats in battle.
    - [Precision F-Strike](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecisionFStrike): She might yell, "Die, damn you!" in the middle of a fight.

[Department of Redundancy Department](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DepartmentOfRedundancyDepartment): Name version. "Jordis" means "Sword Maiden" in Norwegian, which makes her name Sword Maiden the Sword-Maiden.
[The Fettered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFettered): She takes her oath to serve you *very* seriously. Unlike Lydia, she says "I am sworn to carry your burdens" without a hint of sarcasm.

[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): Nothing short of the nicest character in the entire *Elder Scrolls* franchise, and that is just the vanilla version. Mods replacing cut dialogue make Jordis three times as vocal and helpful, and she is such a sweetheart and so kind and friendly that she is a popular voice option for fan made content.

[Single Woman Seeks Good Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SingleWomanSeeksGoodMan): Well, man or woman. Cut dialogue has her latch onto the Dragonborn like they were already married, and if you go through with it, Jordis is this up to eleven.
[They Call Him "Sword"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheyCallHimSword): Her sobriquet.
[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): If you don't fight back against enemies attacking you, Jordis *will* call you out on it and demand you defend yourself.
[Bow and Sword in Accord](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BowAndSwordInAccord): She will use a bow against distant targets and her sword against close ones.
[Colonel Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColonelBadass): She's implied to be of high rank in the Imperial Army or at least the East Empire Company, since Orthus says she's one of the higher-ups.

[Gameplay and Story Segregation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation): She's supposed to be a warrior, but her top skills are Alchemy, Smithing and Enchanting. The Unofficial Patch changes her to a one-handed warrior type.
[Old Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OldSoldier): She's noticeably silver-haired, and her face is quite lined.

[Surrounded by Idiots](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SurroundedByIdiots): She's very pleased that the Dovahkiin is competent and getting things done.
QUOTE **Adelaisa:** Glad Orthus was able to find someone competent to help out.
[Action Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionMom): She has a daughter.

tropeName: Be Careful What You Wish For
tropeNotes: [Be Careful What You Wish For](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeCarefulWhatYouWishFor): While the ore vein she discovered was prosperous enough to establish the settlement of Darkwater Crossing and its associated mine, this unfortunately led to [Small Town Boredom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallTownBoredom) when she realized she was now tied down in one place.
[Follower-In-Law](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BestFriendsInLaw): The Dragonborn can marry her daughter.
[Founder of the Settlement](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FounderOfTheKingdom): She was the one who discovered the mine, leading to the establishment of Darkwater Crossing.

[Older Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanTheyLook): She has a full-grown daughter, which would make her in her late thirties or early forties at least. She certainly doesn't look it; in fact, when standing next to her daughter, they look like they could be sisters.
[Parenting The Wife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentingTheHusband): Her husband, Verner, desperately wants her to act her age. It *doesn't* work.
[Retired Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredBadass): Until/unless she returns to adventuring alongside the Dragonborn.
[Small Town Boredom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallTownBoredom): Her reason for following the Dragonborn.
[Wet Blanket Wife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WetBlanketWife): Inverted. She wants to do some adventuring, to the annoyance of her husband.
[Artificial Stupidity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialStupidity): Due to a glitch, he can become inexplicably trapped in the cave where you find him, unable to follow you out of the exit.
[Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatchPhrase): "Ours is to follow, friend."
[Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding): Will use his pickaxe as well as another weapon you give him.

[Idiot Ball](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IdiotBall): How he got imprisoned by the Falmer. Upon freeing him, the first thing he does is to kick himself for about how utterly stupid it was to swim into an unexplored cave when he didn't know *what* was in there first.
[I Owe You My Life](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IOweYouMyLife): Derkeethus follows you because you saved his life and will stand by your side no matter what. "To Oblivion and back, as they say."
[Lizard Folk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LizardFolk): As an Argonian. He's also the only Argonian follower in the game.

[Made of Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadeOfIron): Due to the incredibly buggy nature of his recruitment quest, his essential status never gets removed, making it impossible for enemies to kill him. This means that, while his stats are average at best, he's actually one of the most useful followers in the game.
[Recruitment by Rescue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecruitmentByRescue): You recruit this guy by rescuing him from a Falmer den.
[Rescue Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RescueRomance): If you choose to marry him.
[Runaway Groom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RunawayGroom): Because of a glitch, when attempting to marry him, he has a tendency to sprint out of the chapel in the middle of the ceremony.
[This Is Gonna Suck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisIsGonnaSuck): Entering a vast room with no enemies to be seen? He sees this a mile away.

[Weapon Specialization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeaponSpecialization): The bow, which he will use as long as he has arrows, even if you give him ridiculously powerful melee weapons. The solution, of course, is to give him ridiculously powerful bows instead. In melee combat, he almost always uses his pickaxe and will simply resort to [Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding) if given another melee weapon.
[Animalistic Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalisticAbomination): Only *looks* like a [Big Friendly Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFriendlyDog).

[Arbitrary Skepticism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArbitrarySkepticism): Calls the player out on this, if they make the [You Can Talk?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouCanTalk) observation.
QUOTE **Barbas:** Yeah, Skyrim is full of giant, flying lizards and two-legged cat-men, and you're surprised by me? Yeah, I just talked. And am continuing to do so.
[Artificial Stupidity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialStupidity): He has a habit of pushing players off cliffs. He is also set to stay *very* close to you.
[Big Friendly Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFriendlyDog): He's really this terrifying Daedric creature, and yet he still barks at butterflies.
[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Much like his master, in fact, but not at all malicious.

[Made of Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadeOfIron): He seems to be completely invincible. Justified in that he's an aspect of sorts to Clavicus Vile, who - as a Daedric Prince - can't be killed.  (SPOILER) With one exception: taking up Clavicus Vile on his offer to [give Barbas the axe.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouHaveOutlivedYourUsefulness) Literally.

[Morality Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityPet): Literally, to Clavicus Vile. He says this in a bit of unused dialogue:
QUOTE **Barbas:** I tend to be the voice of reason and he finds that... irksome.

[Talking Animal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TalkingAnimal): [The Dragonborn can bring up this fact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConversedTrope), whereupon Barbas will comment on their [Arbitrary Skepticism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArbitrarySkepticism).
[Taken for Granite](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakenForGranite):  (SPOILER) Reuniting him with Clavicus causes him to reclaim his post as the other half of the Daedric Prince's statue.

[Unexplained Accent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnexplainedAccent): Barbas speaks with what sounds like a Brooklyn accent. Though a good number of characters speak with (nondescript) American accents, such a specific accent can come off as... out of place.
[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): Despite his duties, he comes off as a fairly decent person who treats his job as what it is: a job.
[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): You'll likely notice him immediately upon entering Solitude, as the headsman in charge of executing Roggvir.

[Off with His Head!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OffWithHisHead): He's a headsman, so his job is to behead prisoners. He's pretty blasé about it, however. Ironically, he doesn't have the Devastating Blow perk that would allow him to lop off heads in combat.
[Scary Black Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScaryBlackMan): Aside from his job, he's notably much larger and more muscular than other Redguards as well as having a rather deep voice.
[Adventurer Archaeologist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdventurerArchaeologist): He shows excitement when visiting ancient Nordic tombs.
[Deflector Shields](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeflectorShields): He often uses the Ward spells.
[An Ice Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson): Knows Ice Spike, with the Unoffical Patch.

[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Prides himself on being a spellsword. Without the Unofficial Patch, however, he knows no destruction spells.
QUOTE "Versatility is the key to survival. Hire me, and you'll well-prepared to face threats both magical and mundane."

[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): Stands out among the followers as this. He doesn't have a [Dark and Troubled Past](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkAndTroubledPast), a dark secret, or a hidden agenda; he's just a mercenary who loves life and will happily adventure across Skyrim at your side. Even his obligatory inventory-carrying joke is more lighthearted than passive-aggressive.
[Stone Wall](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StoneWall): He can be even tougher than housecarls because he buffs and heals himself.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): As a female Orc, this is a given.
[Amazonian Beauty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmazonianBeauty): She's a tall, muscular woman who is quite pretty.

[Arranged Marriage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArrangedMarriage): She joins up with you to escape one. She seems pretty unwilling, in any case.
QUOTE **Bagrak:** Soon you will be of age. 
**Borgakh:** I would sooner join the Legion than be married to some weak chief!
[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): Not a mage or anyone specially trained, just a [Orc warrior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProudWarriorRaceGuy).
[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): One of her random comments is, "My blood's calm. I prefer it boiling."
[The Chief's Daughter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChiefsDaughter): She has most of the traits, but wants to escape a arranged marriage.
[Don't You Dare Pity Me!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DontYouDarePityMe): A minor example, but if you use Healing Hands on her to heal her wounds, she'll complain that an Orc lets wounds heal naturally.
[Hot Guy, Ugly Wife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotGuyUglyWife): Possibly (she can be married); but for an Orc, she's fairly attractive.

tropeName: Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me
tropeNotes: [Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LuckilyMyShieldWillProtectMe): An odd case in that her *stats* are geared for a sword-and-shield one-handed approach, but she seems to prefer using bows at long range in battle instead unless you make sure she doesn't have any bows or arrows.

[Marry for Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MarryForLove): She does this, happily, if you ask her to marry you. She comments that marriage feels right this time and compliments your cleverness and strength.
[Proud Warrior Race Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProudWarriorRaceGuy): Once again, as a female Orc. When married, she'll frequently tell you "Conquer your enemies, my love."

[Rebellious Princess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RebelliousPrincess): As the daughter of the chief, she doesn't want to be "the third wife of some lowly chieftain" and will gladly follow you should you persuade her to do so.
[Statuesque Stunner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatuesqueStunner): Since she's a orc, and a attractive one at that, she's taller than any race but Altmer.
[Stealth Expert](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StealthExpert): She's got surprisingly good sneak ability, tied for 10th best in the game for a follower.
[Stone Wall](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StoneWall): She's skilled in heavy armor and her default armor levels up to Orcish in quality, giving her good defense, and you can give her even better armor.
[Technicolor Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TechnicolorEyes): She has yellow eyes with [cross-shaped pupils and smaller dark specks in the irises](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExoticEyeDesigns).
[Tiny Guy, Huge Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TinyGuyHugeGirl): If you're playing as anyone but a Nord, Altmer, or another Orc, she'll be noticeably taller than you.
[Tribal Facepaint](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TribalFacepaint): Has blood-red tears painted on her face (as if her eyes are welling up and running over).

[Video Game Caring Potential](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VideoGameCaringPotential): She's going to be forced into a [Arranged Marriage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArrangedMarriage) against her will, and you can either pay off her bride-price or persuade her to opt out of it. You can even have [her marry you](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MarryForLove) or join the Blades.

[Above the Influence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AboveTheInfluence): It's possible for Alva to hit on him, and Benor says he'll agree, *if* Alva leaves that "kinslayer" Hroggar. Alva says Hroggar doesn't have to know, but *that* causes Benor to flatly turn her down, refusing to "cuckold" Hroggar even if Benor thinks Hroggar's a murderer.
[Defeat Means Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatMeansFriendship): How you recruit him. It also allows to marry him.

[Dirty Coward](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DirtyCoward): Benor's AI personality traits list him as unaggressive in combat, of average confidence, and being unwilling yo help anyone. This means in combat he's more likely to flee or cower in fear of a decently strong foe than help the player fight them as a follower.

[Gameplay and Story Segregation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation): During the "Laid to Rest" quest, he's part of the [Torches and Pitchforks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TorchesAndPitchforks) party who goes to Morvath's lair, and then is too afraid to actually enter the vampire's den. At this point, he's normally scripted to go back to Morthal with the other NPCs, but if he's already available as a follower, asking him to team up with you results in Benor entering the cave anyway, with no other consequence.

[Knight in Sour Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightInSourArmor): He's not pleased with the Jarl of Hjaalmarch, whom he feels isn't doing enough to protect the citizens of Morthal. He feels that Morthal used to be a quiet place, back when the world made sense. So what does he do about it? He joins up with Morthal's guards to help them out.

[Not Distracted by the Sexy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotDistractedByTheSexy): Well, not distracted by *Alva's* sexy, anyway, as described in the Above the Influence trope. The player can marry him, though.

[Red Oni, Blue Oni](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedOniBlueOni): Sort of. He's the blue oni to his good friend Gorm's red. You can learn this in a minor conversation, but Gorm wants to do something immediately about his and Benor's mutual dissatisfaction with Morthal's Jarl, while Benor would prefer to wait until the time is right, when they're sure.
[The Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner): Used to be a Daedric Lord's priest, but abandoned his order and became a priest of Mara instead.
[Badass Preacher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassPreacher): Being a priest of Mara and being a powerful mage are not mutually exclusive.
[The Bard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBard): He used to attend the Bard's College in Solitude, but was kicked out for  (SPOILER) worshiping Vaermina .
[Battle Cry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleCry): "Feel the benevolence of Mara!"
[Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatchPhrase): "Blessings of Mara upon you."

[Developer's Foresight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DevelopersForesight): Erandur is one of the few followers with different remarks for basically every location in Skyrim, from major cities to bandit camps. The most notable is his remark that he's always wanted to make a pilgrimage to the Temple of Mara, should you take him there.
[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): He claims that he had good parents and has no bad memories of them; he thinks he'll visit their resting place sometime.
[Heel–Faith Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaithTurn): He used to worship a Daedric Prince, but turned good and started worshiping Mara instead.
[Kill It with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithFire): One of his favorite spells is a ramped-up fireball.
[Kung-Fu Wizard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KungFuWizard): Erandur can take almost as much of a beating as Lydia or your other companions.
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): He often uses a mace and a fire spell. He's also a mean hand with Destruction staves.

[Master of None](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterOfNone): Sadly, he becomes this at higher levels, despite being a [Crutch Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrutchCharacter) at lower levels; it's because he uses the Priest class, which is not only a civilian class, but also has terrible synergy with his abilities. He will end up with an above-average HP pool because of his high level cap, but because he has no armor skills, he can't serve well as a tank, and he also gets a huge stamina pool, but because he has no weapon skills, he isn't a good offensive fighter either. He can cast some spells, but his Magicka pool is a very tiny 50 points and never increases, making him sub-par as a mage as well.
[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): One of the few followers who are fine with hauling your stuff around.
[Older Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanTheyLook): He states that he grew up in The Pale and has lived there for most of his life, which is longer than the Dovahkiin may think.

[Ooh, Me Accent's Slipping](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OohMeAccentsSlipping): Erandur's battle dialogue and some of his unique lines said when he isn't being spoken to directly are in the normal, nasal Dark Elf voice, as opposed to his usual deep voice. [Keith Szarabajka](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/KeithSzarabajka) wasn't able to go the full [Joshua Graham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FalloutNewVegas) route for this preacher.

[Sadistic Choice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SadisticChoice):  (SPOILER) It's either have him as follower, or kill him and gain possession of a nice magic staff.  Of course, it's not really sadistic if you're a good guy,  (SPOILER) since doing the bidding of the Lady of Nightmares is not something you'd be inclined to do even if it *didn't* involve killing a decent man. However, if you're attempting to get the "Oblivion Walker" achievement, letting him live means giving up the chance to acquire one of the fifteen required artifacts. (Your best bet in that case is to leave his quest for the last of the fifteen, save the game before the choice, and then wait until the achievement unlocks before reloading.)

[Stuff Blowing Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StuffBlowingUp): Tends to favour using Destruction magic in battle, despite his stats revealing that he's far more skilled at Conjuration. One explanation for this might be that  (SPOILER) his [Heel–Faith Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaithTurn) from a Daedra worshiper  is why he doesn't use it anymore, since that school is heavily associated with  (SPOILER) the Daedra and Oblivion .
[That Man Is Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThatManIsDead): "I no longer use that name [Casimir]. [I'm Erandur, priest of Mara](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyNameIsInigoMontoya)."

[Unexplained Accent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnexplainedAccent): He has quite a fantastic one compared to other followers, though it's mainly because no other follower in the game shares his voice type.

[The Alcoholic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAlcoholic): He drinks constantly because "There's no shipments coming in, so I do nothing. Just drink." If you use [Healing Hands](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingHands) on him, he says "Hey, my hangover's gone!".
[Best Him To Bed Him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BestHerToBedHer): If you beat him up, he'll become available for marriage.

[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): The Unofficial Skyrim Patch changes him to a two-handed Barbarian warrior to suit his armor better, so giving him a greatsword, battleaxe, or warhammer would be best.
[Bow and Sword in Accord](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BowAndSwordInAccord): Uses his mace for close enemies, and a bow for more distant enemies.
[Affably Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffablyEvil): She's rather polite for a bloodthirsty cannibal.
[Beware the Silly Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheSillyOnes): Don't let yourself be fool by her first impression; she's pretty much a psychotic cannibal.

[Cloud Cuckoolander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CloudCuckoolander): She seems a bit like this when you first meet her, especially as she goes on about how she knows you know what it's like to be a cannibal... even if you haven't actually eaten any human flesh up to this point in the game. Even though the Dragonborn has a [Multiple-Choice Past](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MultipleChoicePast) already, it's likely this is just a seduction tactic; tellingly, if you flat out refuse her right off the bat, she'll just say "To Oblivion with you, then!" and attack you.
[Dark Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkActionGirl): Female, psychotic, and *very* good at kicking ass.
[Handicapped Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandicappedBadass): Being blind in one eye doesn't hamper her any.
[I'm a Humanitarian](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImAHumanitarian): She's part of a cult of cannibals who worship Namira.
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Efficient in One-Handed combat and Destruction magic.
[Necromancer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Necromancer): Eola is the only follower in the base game capable of reanimating fallen enemies.
[Nightmare Fetishist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NightmareFetishist): She is part of a cannibal cult worshiping the Daedric Prince of Revulsion. Can hardly fit the trope better.

[Psycho Sidekick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychoSidekick): Granted, the game's universe is a huge case of [Grey-and-Gray Morality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GreyAndGrayMorality), but Eola's right up there with Cicero when it comes to psychotic followers.
[Nobody Calls Me "Chicken"!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NobodyCallsMeChicken): One of the dialogue options for recruiting him essentially boils down to this. Ghorbash takes it as a challenge.
[Retired Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredBadass): Previously served in the Imperial Legion before returning to the stronghold.

[Small Town Boredom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallTownBoredom): Of a sort. Although his brother acted against usual orcish sensibilities by welcoming him back into the stronghold after Ghorbash left to serve in the Legion, he still has a strong urge to wander. The speech check required to make him a follower calls him out on this.
[Adventurer Archaeologist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdventurerArchaeologist): He's fascinated by the Dwemer and will comment about them frequently when in Dwemer ruins.

[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): Like Cosnach, Unofficial Skyrim Patch changes him to a two-handed Barbarian warrior to suit his armor better, so giving him a greatsword, battleaxe, or warhammer would be best.
[Bow and Sword in Accord](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BowAndSwordInAccord): Like most non-mage followers, he will use a bow against far away enemies.
[Speech Impediment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpeechImpediment): Has a noticeable lisp when he talks.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): A pretty good witch.
[The Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner): It's implied that she did many morally questionable things before her [Heel Realization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelRealization).
[Heel Realization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelRealization): Upon realizing that she simply isn't comfortable with crossing the [Moral Event Horizon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralEventHorizon).
[Hot Witch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotWitch): She's really fairly attractive, unlike some of her ilk.
[An Ice Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson): Her primary combat spells are ice based.
[Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice): How most of her kills will end up, due to her reliance on Icy Spear for offense.

[It Only Works Once](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItOnlyWorksOnce): Due to a bug, you may only get the follower recruitment dialogue with her once. It can even be squandered if you already have a follower when you ask.
[Not What It Looks Like](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotWhatItLooksLike): What she says after the Dragonborn witnesses her killing another witch.
[Self-Made Orphan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfMadeOrphan): Although it's in self-defense.
[Token Heroic Orc](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenHeroicOrc): Most witches you come across are wicked Daedric worshipers that attack on sight. Illia is about the only exception.

[Video Game Caring Potential](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VideoGameCaringPotential): After you help her end her quest, she doesn't really know what to do anymore and becomes a follower for you as a way to move on, staying in the tower where she killed her mother when you dismiss her. On the bright side, she is available to become a Steward in *Hearthfire*, so it is possible to recruit her, thus giving her a new home, a new life, and a new purpose. Unfortunately, she is *not* essential, and can possibly be [Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen) by something attacking your home while you're away.

[Adventure Archaeologist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdventureArchaeologist): He claims to be highly knowledgeable on the topic of Nordic ruins and will consider taking a few items from Dwemer ruins to take back to Cyrodiil.
[Arrogant Kung-Fu Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArrogantKungFuGuy): "If these ruins frighten you, take comfort in the knowledge that *I* am here."
[Badass Bookworm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBookworm): Some of his dialogue suggests he is well-educated.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): He's one of the more talkative followers who often make comments on some places even when not talked to, and complains that you're using him as a pack mule when asked to carry things.
[Disc-One Nuke](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscOneNuke): He's actually one of the more offensively powerful followers, and will join you as long as you have 500 gold when you get to Riften.
[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe): Uses Lightning Bolts as his main spells.
[Trigger-Happy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TriggerHappy): Since he has Chain Lightning, he can (and will, repeatedly) electrocute you in combat.
[Tsundere](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tsundere): If you marry him and use him as a follower, then you'll get both the standard marriage dialogue and his snarky remarks.

[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton):
    - She considers the Thieves' Guild even lower than the Dark Brotherhood, since she believes the latter have some degree of standards. [As a follower, however](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation), she can be taken to the Ragged Flagon with no ill effect and can even be present during (SPOILER) your initiation as a Nightingale or being named leader of the Thieves' Guild . - This can possibly be explained by the fact that she really hates bandits as well, since bandits burned down her village and killed her brother when she was a child.
QUOTE **Mjoll:** I hope there's more bandits around... Their numbers could use a little more thinning.

[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): She's better at two-handed than one-handed, so giving her a greatsword rather than a regular one is better for her. The Unofficial Patch makes Grimsever a two-handed glass greatsword.
[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): She *loves* to fight, as repeatedly stated in her dialogue.

[Boisterous Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoisterousBruiser): A rare female example.
QUOTE **Mjoll:** Ha! Think you can take me?

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): When talking to Maven Black-Briar, she's much more rude and sarcastic, naturally.
QUOTE **Mjoll:** Maven. How's the criminal underworld treating you this fine day?

[Deceased Parents Are the Best](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeceasedParentsAreTheBest): She'll fondly remember some things about her parents when you adventure with her, always speaking of them in the past tense or mentioning that she misses them.

[Developer's Foresight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DevelopersForesight): She comments on it if you bring her to Mzinchaleft, where she was severely injured.
QUOTE **Mjoll:** Mzinchaleft. I swore I'd never return here.
[Doomed Hometown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedHometown): When in a bandit hideout, she will mention that her village was destroyed by bandits when she was young.

[Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil): To Maven Black-Briar. Both are Nord women who live in Riften; while Maven is a corrupt businesswoman who backs the [Thieves' Guild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThievesGuild) and treats the player with hostility even after they help her *more than once*, Mjoll is a warrior who opposes all corruption, despises the Thieves' Guild, and is never rude to the player (even if they're *in* the guild). Ironically, though, Mjoll's morality is set to 0 (Any Crime) whereas Maven's morality is set to 3 (No Crime), so Mjoll will commit any crime the player asks her to whereas if modded as a follower, Maven would refuse.

[Friendly Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendlyEnemy): It's never mentioned in-universe, and it's most likely just a case of [Gameplay and Story Segregation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation), but you can befriend her even if you are a Thieves' Guild member, or even the Guildmaster. That's right, you can be friends with her even though, from her perspective, you are pretty much part of the [Big Bad Ensemble](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBadEnsemble) (the other part being Maven Black-Briar).

[Just Friends](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustFriends): Apparently, herself and Aerin. Aerin will go *anywhere* Mjoll goes - including *your* house, should you marry her. He will even follow her  (SPOILER) to Sky Haven Temple, should you get her to join the Blades!  This can be bad, as  (SPOILER)  he'll follow her on their dragon hunting expeditions .

[Made of Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadeOfIron): Because of her quest (and her [Dummied Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DummiedOut) role against the Thieves' Guild), Mjoll is permanently tagged as "essential" and thus literally cannot be killed by any enemy in the game, or even friendly fire. This alone makes her one of the most useful companions in the game, as you don't have to worry about her getting killed in combat, though she'll still turn on you if you attack her enough.

[Motor Mouth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MotorMouth): One of the more talkative followers, to the point that she will talk during excursions into danger-filled caves and tombs and will talk over other NPCs during scripted story moments.
[Named Weapons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedWeapons): Her sword, Grimsever.
[Older Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanTheyLook): You'd never know it from just looking at her, but some of her comments imply that she's somewhat past her prime.

[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): Before patch 1.9, if you were level 81 before talking to her the first time, you could never recruit her, since she'd only give you the quest to retrieve Grimsever after you leveled up once after meeting her.

tropeName: The Pirates Who Don't Do Anything
tropeNotes: [The Pirates Who Don't Do Anything](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePiratesWhoDontDoAnything): Despite her claims to be an opponent of the Thieves' Guild and the Black-Briars, she's never seen doing anything other than lamenting their presence in Riften. Even if you tell her that you're interested in joining the Thieves' Guild, she simply expresses mild disappointment at you. Dialogue between her and Aerin suggest that she does have run-ins with them offscreen, but he tries to convince her into limiting her actions to avoid having Maven send her to jail "or worse." She also does help the guards take down thieves whenever one shows up. Of course she *is* a follower, and thus this can be subverted if the player takes her along to do things that undermine the Black-Briars.
[Platonic Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlatonicLifePartners): With Aerin, to whom she remains very close even if she marries the Dragonborn.
[Retired Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredBadass): Though you can inspire her to make a comeback.
[Tribal Face Paint](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TribalFacePaint): Wears blue face paint on half of her face.

[Unknown Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnknownRival): To the Thieves' Guild. Despite being the only resident of Riften who openly opposes them, none of them seem that concerned with her as they never even talk about her. That said, there is a "Danger" shadowmark on her door.
[We Help the Helpless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeHelpTheHelpless): Her reason for staying in Riften.

tropeName: Why Did It Have to Be Snakes?
tropeNotes: [Why Did It Have to Be Snakes?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhyDidItHaveToBeSnakes): She dislikes Dwemer ruins, after almost losing her life in Mzinchaleft, and will wearily remind you of this if you take her into one, remarking that she had hoped to never see one again. If you take her to Mzinchaleft in particular, she will mention that she had never intended to return there.

[Woman Of The City](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManOfTheCity): Sees herself as Riften's protector, and vehemently opposes both the Thieves' Guild and Black-Briar dynasty (or at least [she claims to do so](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation)). As noted above, it's been indicated that there was supposed to have been a questline in which she worked more actively against them, but it was cut.

[Ascended Fanboy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedFanboy): A meta example. Erik the Slayer is based off of Erik West, who was known as "Immok the Slayer" on the forums before he died of cancer in May 2011.
[Farm Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FarmBoy): Subverted in that he's not resistant to adventure - it's his biggest dream, and he [doesn't miss farming at all](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatchPhrase).
[Jumped at the Call](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JumpedAtTheCall): Takes the first opportunity that he can to just leave and start adventuring.
